article.title: Radiating Electron Interaction with Multiple Colliding Electromagnetic Waves: Random Walk Trajectories, Levy Flights, Limit Circles, and Attractors (Survey of the Structurally Determinate Patterns)

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the parameter plane in Figure 1a depict?
choices: Different regimes of laser power and intensity.
Different regimes of electron-positron pair production.
Different regimes of electromagnetic field interaction with matter.
Different regimes of radiation friction in quantum electrodynamics.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the intersecting lines in Figure 1b represent?
choices: Transition points between different QED regimes.
Thresholds for pair production and radiation dominance.
Critical values for EM wave amplitude and frequency.
Optimal values for Compton scattering and Breit-Wheeler processes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of electron motion does Figure 2 primarily illustrate?
choices: Regular motion within a narrow region near the electric field maximum.
Trapping in a limit circle after an initial unstable phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the form-factor Ge(χe) in Equation (23) represent?
choices: Ratio of full radiation intensity to the intensity emitted by a classical electron.
Probability of gamma-photon emission in the Compton scattering process.
Probability of electron-positron pair creation in the Breit-Wheeler process.
Strength of the electromagnetic field normalized by the QED critical field.
